xwikidoc.name: ccmArchive20131122
xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #ccm on 22 November 2013
xwikidoc.content: <sdumitriu1> has joined #ccm 12:40 <natani> has joined #ccm 12:41 <natani> sdumitriu: hey, I want to contribute to the org. can you guide me through the steps needed to be followed? 12:42 <sdumitriu1> Hi natani 12:43 <sdumitriu1> As part of GSoC? 12:44 <natani> Yes :) 12:44 <sdumitriu1> Excellent 12:45 <sdumitriu1> Did you find something interesting in 2013's list of project ideas? 12:47 <natani> yes, actually I was thinking to contribute to an organization which works in the area of high performance computing, I saw the project list and found the project titled as Parallelization of Queries in MedSavant interesting. But I don't know much about the project that's why I want to know more about the organization and it's works. 12:56 <sdumitriu1> Hold on a bit, debugging something 12:57 <natani> Sure 13:04 <sdumitriu1> So, while the CCM does handle a bit of HPC, I wouldn't say that it is an organization that's a good host for HPC projects, in the broad sense 13:05 <sdumitriu1> The MedSavant parallelization was selected this year, and the project was successful 13:07 <sdumitriu1> But we can find some ideas for you 13:07 <natani> ok, fine so what all projects do you have which are in your todo list? may be I can find something to contribute to.. :) 13:10 <sdumitriu1> Strictly HPC, or general ideas 13:14 <natani> General ones, keeping HiPC aside, my purpose for doing GSoC this year is more for open source contribution, I am anyway doing my research in HPC. So if the goal of having a good experience of open source contribution is achieved, I will be more than happy. 13:15 <sdumitriu1> So what's your level? BSc, Msc? 13:16 <natani> I am in my pre-final/third year of B.Tech. (Computer Science). 13:16 <sdumitriu1> Good 13:17 <sdumitriu1> Do you prefer Java, Mobile apps, or Web? 13:17 <natani> Web or java both are ok. I have no experience with mobile apps development. 13:18 <sdumitriu1> This is an interesting project: https://gsoc.ccm.sickkids.ca/GoogleSummerOfCode/Multiple+visits+support+in+PhenoTips 13:18 <sdumitriu1> What do you think about it? 13:24 <natani> ok, I got the second and the third point, that these functionalities can be added. But how can the new visit be unnamed ? as they allow to track different versions saved for the same patients. Anyway, the project looks good. 13:25 <natani> Did you propose it for GSoC 2014? 13:35 <sdumitriu1> Yes 13:36 <natani> So how should I start contributing? 13:36 <sdumitriu1> Hold on, debugging something else 14:00 <sdumitriu1> So, first step is to stick around 14:01 <sdumitriu1> Since that project is about PhenoTips, you should learn more about it 14:01 <sdumitriu1> Read the documentation available at http://phenotips.org/ 14:02 <sdumitriu1> Especially the developer resources http://phenotips.org/DeveloperResources/ 14:02 <sdumitriu1> (not that many now, though...) 14:03 <sdumitriu1> You should try to get the sources, build the project, and run it to see how it works 14:04 <natani> Ok, I will read and try it and get back to you. It's 4:30 AM here in my country, I should go to sleep now. By the way , thanks a lot. See you tomorrow. 14:08 <sdumitriu1> Good night natani, see you tomorrow 23:03 <natani> has joined #ccm 23:41 <natani> I am trying to build the project using $ mvn install and get the error like: http://paste.ubuntu.com/6462634/
